bibl.title: A. C. Hallam v. Henry M. White. Writ of Habeas Corpus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: The District Court of the United States, Western District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: In the Matter of the Petition of A. C. Hallam for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.
THE PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA,
To E. H. Bodwin, Mayor and Chief of Police ex officio of the City of Bremerton, County of Kitsap, Washington,

WE COMMAND YOU, that you have the body of A. C. Hallam by you imprisoned and detained, as it is said, together with the time and cause of such imprisonment and detention, by whatsoever name said A. C. Hallam shall be called or charged, before the Honorable Edward E. Cushman, United States District Judge for the Western District of Washington, at Seattle, at the United States District Court Department No. 2, Federal Building, in the City of Seattle, in the Northern Division of said Western District of Washington, on the 17th day of January, 1921, at 1:30 o'clock in the afternoon, to do and receive what shall then and there be considered concerning the said A. C. Hallam. And have you then and there this writ.

WITNESS the Honorable EDWARD E. CUSHMAN, Judge of the United States District Court for the District of Washington, this 12th day of January, in the year of our Lord one thousand nine hundred twenty-one.
Let the within Writ issue. Dated at Seattle, Washington, Jan. 12, 1921.
In the District Court of the United States for the Western District of Washington.
In the Matter of the Petition of A. C. Hallam for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.
Filed in the United States District Court
